TopicTitle: Will this PC handle KSP in 1080p @ 60fps?

Articles.Content:
The site is in swedish but you should be able to see the specs: http://www.prisjakt.nu/list.php?l=2698059&view=l

I will mostly use it for KSP but some Civ and Minecraft too. Will I be able to play in 1080p @ 60fps?

Thanks for eventual answers, this is my first forum post, but hopefully the first of many! Thanks!

Yes. No. Rubber band.

It totally depends on the craft you are launching. A 1200 part craft with mods is something different than a 120 part craft in a stock game.

Yes for the most part you will be able to play those games @1080p with a solid 60FPS. Of course you will get frame dips with large crafts (350-500+parts), and turns may take longer to process as your near endgame in Civ V. Otherwise this is a good rig and you should be happy with it's performance.

Yes. No. Rubber band.

It totally depends on the craft you are launching. A 1200 part craft with mods is something different than a 120 part craft in a stock game.

Yes for the most part you will be able to play those games @1080p with a solid 60FPS. Of course you will get frame dips with large crafts (350-500+parts), and turns may take longer to process as your near endgame in Civ V. Otherwise this is a good rig and you should be happy with it's performance.

Thanks! I didn't think it wouldn't lag with large crafts, but at least be able to handle medium to small ships.

The CPU is bad for KSP (but still good for most other games), Intel is way faster in KSP due to way bigger single thread performance.

Also the PSU is extremly overpowerded, 300-400W are enough.
